sentences.en: Arbaces gave him not breathing time to recover his stupor.
sentences.cn: 阿耳巴刻斯不让他有喘息和复苏的机会.

sentences.en: As the whisky took effect, he gradually fell into a drunken stupor.
sentences.cn: 随着威士忌酒力发作, 他逐渐醉得不省人事.

sentences.en: He collapsed in a drunken stupor.
sentences.cn: 他酒喝得不省人事而倒在地上.

sentences.en: He drank himself into a stupor.
He fell back onto the sofa in a drunken stupor.
sentences.cn: 他烂醉如泥，瘫倒在沙发上。

sentences.en: He fell to the ground in a stupor.
He was drinking himself into a stupor every night.
sentences.cn: 他每晚都喝得不省人事。

sentences.en: He was so tired that he plodded along in a stupor.
sentences.cn: 他筋疲力尽,只知昏昏沉沉地拖着脚步往前走.

sentences.en: He went on reading in a kind of stupor.
sentences.cn: 他怀着一种麻痹的神情继续读下去.

sentences.en: It was gin that sank him into stupor every night.
sentences.cn: 他靠杜松子酒每晚沉醉如死.

sentences.en: Marianne only more quiet, not more herself, remained in an heavy stupor.
sentences.cn: 玛丽安只是安静了一些--已不省人事--耽留于深度昏迷状态.

sentences.en: The noise of someone banging at the door roused her from her stupor.
sentences.cn: 梆梆的敲门声把她从昏迷中唤醒了.

sentences.en: The pain roused him from his drunken stupor.
sentences.cn: 他喝得烂醉如泥，而后一阵疼痛把他疼醒了。

sentences.en: Then she felt herself go into a kind of stupor of exhaustion.
sentences.cn: 不久,她只感到陷入一种精疲力竭的麻木状态.

sentences.en: We drank ourselves into a stupor on cheap wine.
sentences.cn: 我们喝廉价葡萄酒喝得酩酊大醉。

sentences.en: We found him lying at the bottom of the stairs in a drunken stupor .
sentences.cn: 我们发现他躺在楼梯口，醉得不省人事。

words.tran_cn: 昏迷的，不省人事的；无感觉的

trans.tran_cn: 目光呆滞，恍惚，昏迷，惊愕
trans.tran_en: a state in which you cannot think, speak, see, or hear clearly, usually because you have drunk too much alcohol or taken drugs
